document.title: Remembering Things We’ve Never Done: Memory’s Daughters and the Literary Experience
document.abstract: Memory, essential in creative writing, inspires us to weave literary reading into the narrative of personal experience and to seek, through recollection, our psychic wholeness.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning
